content:
Diagnosis:		Metastatic papillary renal cell carcinoma type 1

Staging:		T3bN1M1 at diagnosis January 2024
		CK19 positive
		Progressive bone and liver metastases

Treatment:		15 Jan 2024 Left radical nephrectomy
		1 Feb - 15 Mar 2024 Cabozantinib 60mg daily
		20 Mar 2024 Emergency admission with cord compression
		22-29 Mar 2024 Palliative radiotherapy to T8-T10

Current situation:	Seen following admission

I reviewed [redacted name] today following recent emergency admission. Unfortunately, there has been significant clinical deterioration over the past 2 weeks with increasing back pain, new right upper quadrant pain, and marked fatigue limiting mobility. Performance status has declined from 1 to 3. Recent CT shows progressive disease with 30% increase in liver metastases and new vertebral deposits at T8-T10 causing cord compression, though some response in para-aortic nodes.

He has completed emergency radiotherapy to T8-T10 with some improvement in lower limb weakness, but continues to require significant support with mobility. His liver function has deteriorated with bilirubin now 45 and ALT 156. Given the marked clinical decline and radiological progression, we have discussed discontinuing systemic therapy. [redacted name] and family understand the situation and agree with focusing on symptom control.

I have referred to palliative care team for ongoing support and symptom management. We will arrange community support through district nurses. Follow up with palliative care team next week, with telephone review from oncology team in 2 weeks.
